text.KPI 1 description: Average number of interview surveys achieved in the previous two quarters. (We need to take an average over two quarters because the quarterly difference in the target set can vary so much that the target for a quarter can be as low as the threshold below which performance is deemed to be inadequate.  Taking an average would remove the risk of marking the contractor down unfairly.  This KPI is based on the number rather than percentage achieved because it is important that the contractor delivers the number of interviews we need.  The English Housing Survey aims to achieve 13,300 interview surveys a year.  Data collection takes place over eight fieldwork waves so the average number of interviews achieved will be calculated using four fieldwork waves. )
text.KPI 2 description: Number of times a data delivery or the final draft of an annual report is rescheduled with less than 2 weeks' notice. (As the EHS has few such deliveries a quarter - between 7 and 9, the thresholds are based on absolute numbers rather than percentages because absolute number gives a fairer and less misleading guide to performance)
text.KPI 3 description: Number of times a data delivery or the final draft of an annual report misses the scheduled or, where applicable, the revised delivery date.  (As the EHS has few such deliveries a quarter - between 7 and 9, the thresholds are based on absolute numbers rather than percentages because absolute number gives a fairer and less misleading guide to performance.)
text.Comments: KPI 1 not measured because face-to-face data collection was suspended due to the COVID-19 lockdown

text.Contract: Application Maintenance and Support with Systems and Service Integration for the Genesis IT Application
text.KPI 1 description:
Delivery of Service Requests. The system encompasses a wide range of activities, and as such requests for information or specific services are included in the service scope. These are requests from the end users of the system for ad-hoc information that is not available within the existing system reporting tool.                                                                                                                                a) All Service Requests responded to within 1 hour of receipt
b) All Service Requests Allocated to appropriate supplier for dealing and confirmation to Authority of time for completion within 1 day
c) 100% Service Requests delivered to agreed timescales within the Measurement Period
text.KPI 2 description:
Resolution of Severity 3 Incidents. These are disruptions to system processes that can impact upon decision making and create inefficient working practices. Whilst these issues don't lead to system downtime, they can lead to real frustration for the individuals that use the system on a day to day basis.                         a) 80% of Severity 3 Incidents resolved within 4 Working Days.
b) 100% of Severity 3 Incidents resolved within 10 Working Days.
text.KPI 3 description:
Provision of Management Information (MI). By 7am on each Working Day, the MI data on the system must be updated to reflect the 'source systems' from the end of the previous working day.                            a) Data from previous working day is available by 07:00 every Working Day.
b) Data from previous working day is available by 10:00 every Working Day.
text.Comments: Please Note: For all KPIs, Each SLA contained within it is standalone and if failed carries a certain number of service points. If the cumulative number of points exceeds a certain threshold in a reporting month then the entire service may be rated as good or substandard for example.

Soft FM Availability
Intent - To monitor instances that contracted services have not been delivered (i.e. Service Defects)

text.KPI 2 description:
Soft FM Satisfaction
Intent - To monitor instances that contracted services have been delivered to a sub-standard quality (i.e. Service Satisfaction Failures)

text.KPI 1 description:
Core Business Platforms: Availability - Portfolio (ID 1)

To meet this Service Level, the Supplier must achieve the requirements set out in (i) and (ii) and (iii) below:

(i) the agreed percentage of the applications in the Delivery Group meet or exceed the Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category; 
(ii) the average Availability of all applications within each Service Level Category meets or exceeds the Average Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category; and
(iii) each application in the Delivery Group meets or exceeds the Minimum Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category (Gold, Silver, Bronze)
text.Target:
Target Service Level:
Gold Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 99.9%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 99.93%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target 99%

Silver Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 99%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 99.3%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target = 97.5%

Bronze Service Level Category:
(i) 80% of applications in Delivery Group meet or exceed Availability Target of 98%
(ii) Average Availability Target = 98.5%
(iii) Minimum Availability Target = 96%
text.KPI 2 description:
SAP: Availability - Single Applications (ID13)

To meet this Service Level, the Supplier must achieve the requirements set out below:
(i) each application in the Delivery Group meets or exceeds the Minimum Availability Target for the Target Service Level, as set by the Service Level Category (Gold, Silver, Bronze).

This single application failure occurred in May 2020 and it should also be noted that Capgemini met all the KPI measures in both April 2020 and June 2020. Therefore, the overall average service availability for KPI 1 across the quarter exceeded 99.9% of the availability target. This single failure represents the first failure of KPI 1 since the measure was introduced in June 2018.

text.KPI 2 description:
[ID 3] Incident Resolution Times Priority 1 and 2 Incidents

Priority 1 Incident definition: 
50% + users unable to access a national service; or incorrect output likely to mislead the public.

Priority 2 Incident definition: 
10 to 50% of users unable to access a national service, business critical function unavailable or working incorrectly, overnight processing fails to update non business critical data or failure of printed output to the public.
text.Target_1:
[Target Service Level]

Priority 1
All Incidents but one (1) are Resolved within the baseline target Resolution Time of four (4) Service Hours
No Incident takes longer than the extended target Resolution Time of eight (8) Service Hours

Priority 2
All Incidents but two (2) are Resolved within the baseline target Resolution Time of (8) Service Hours
No Incident takes longer than the extended target Resolution Time of twelve (12) Service Hours to Resolve

Helpdesk response to calls, enquiries and complaints

•  the abandoned call rate will not exceed 5% of the total calls each day 
•  at least 99% of inbound queries and complaints will be resolved within 5 Business Days 
•  100% of inbound enquiries and complaints will be resolved within 8 Business Days. 
•  85% of all enquiries must be resolved at first point of contact 
•  at least 99% of all complaints are acknowledged by email and forwarded (where appropriate) within 1 Business Day of receipt 
•  at least 99% of all complaints to the Helpdesk must be resolved within 15 Business Days of receipt 
•  100% of emails, faxes, and letters and text enquiries must be acknowledged within 1 Business Day of receipt 
•  availability of the Helpdesk as set out in Goal 12 in Schedule 4 (Services) Part 1 (Statement of Requirements)
text.KPI 3 description:
Management of operational delivery for the annual testing cycle

•  Progress of Goal 10 delivery milestones in the agreed Operational Delivery Plan, with KPI Service Thresholds of: 
o  Green – delivery milestones have been met 
o  Amber – some delivery milestones have been missed but these do not affect the critical path 
o  Red – missed delivery milestones impact the critical path and contingency measures are required

text.Contract: Personal Independence Payment (PIP) Lot 3: London, South (Assessments of entitlement to personal independence payment benefits)
text.KPI 1 description: Unacceptable grade PIP assessment following audit
text.KPI 2 description: The claimant satisfaction rate
text.KPI 3 description: Assessments completed within an average actual clearance time
text.Comments:
IAS have had challenges in recruiting additional FTE in what has been a challenging market due to the uncertainty of Brexit on the wider health and social care sector.  In addition, the then anticipated devolution of PIP in Scotland from April 2020 served as a recruitment detractor. 
This period has been significantly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic across the UK, with the suspension of all face to face assessments taking place. There was a period where no assessments took place at all and a replacement for face to face was designed and delivered in the form of telephone assessments. The effect of COVID-19 on IAS capacity to carry out assessments has been the single biggest challenge within this quarter.

text.Contract: Management of the Adoption Support Fund
text.KPI 1 description: The supplier must ensure that the Fund is distributed in line with demand each financial year in line with government accounting rules (and by building on the existing Government Internal Audit Agency audited process).
text.KPI 2 description: Applications under the current Fair Access Limits (£5k for therapy and £2.5k for specialist assessment), correctly completed by the Local Authority / Regional Adoption Agency, are processed within 20 days.
text.KPI 3 description: All correctly completed applications above the Fair Access Limits are assessed and sent to the Department for approval within 3 working days
text.Comments:
KPI 1: In total 3910 applications have been submitted to the Fund this financial year across all 10 regions - 3514 applications have been approved.
£22,537,773 has been approved for distribution in the financial year 2020-21 taking into account deferred funding from 2019-20. £101.40 has been approved for distribution in the financial year 2021-22.
KPI 2: 2267 applications were processed during this period, all were processed within 15 working days (100%). 
1247 applications were processed during this period, all were processed within 20 working days (100%).
KPI 3: In total 28 applications have been processed for match funding. Once the application has been assessed for completeness, 100% of applications have been sent to the DfE for approval within 3 working days.

text.KPI 1 description:
Retirement Benefit Payments:

•  Target is 100% by Payable Date
•  Or if late application, 100% within 10 working days of receiving an application form

Good: 100% of volume actioned
 
Approaching Target: 99% - <100% of volume Actioned and no outstanding failed cases above 20 days 
 
Requires Improvement: 98% - <99% of volume Actioned and no outstanding failed cases above 30 days 
 
Inadequate: less than 98% of volume actioned or any outstanding failed cases above 45 days
text.KPI 2 description:
Pension Payments

•  Target is 100% on due Date.
text.KPI 3 description:
Death Benefit Payments (continuing entitlement)

•  Target is 100% within 7 working days of receipt of the completed application form

Good: 100% within 7 days of receipt of the completed application form

Approaching Target: 95% within 7 days of receipt of the completed application form and no outstanding failed cases above 20 days
 
Requires improvement: 90% and no outstanding failed cases above 30 days
 
Inadequate: Lower than 90% or any outstanding failed cases above 45 days
text.Comments:
KPI 1: 
•  The Operation continue to experience the increase in applications received as the Summer Retirements Exercise (SRE) has commenced.
•  The teams completed the first month of the SRE and of the 2,458 applications completed during June, in excess of 500 were payable during the month.
KPI 3: 
•  Bereavement casework generated by the increase in notifications and applications continues with casework volumes increasing month-on-month.
•  SLA performance continues to be impacted through clearance of aged casework and a high volume of the outstanding casework awaiting information from a third party.

Comment from Capita “During the quarter we experienced the expected seasonal peak in retirement applications. The SLA was marginally impacted due to the volume of casework received and processed during the period.
Additional resource was added to the Bereavements team during the quarter with training provided. The increase in bereavements has led to an impact on the outstanding case volumes. However, we are now seeing good progress in the clearance of these cases. We expect the SLA performance to continue to be impacted into the next quarter as we continue to reduce these cases further.”

text.KPI 1 description:
Request Fulfilment

Measures:
Service Request Response: The % of all Service Requests raised during the Measurement Period which the Contractor has accepted, rejected or provided a Service Request Impact Notification for within three (3) hours of the time that each Service Request was (a) raised by the Contractor through the creation of a Service Request Record; or (b) received by the Contractor.
Service Request Completion: The % of all Service Requests to which Service Levels for Provisioning apply and due to be completed during the Service Measurement Perion which have been fulfilled in accordance with the Service Levels.
text.KPI 2 description:
Availability Management

Measures: 
Management Information Exchange Availability
Service Desk Availability
Fixed Voice Voicemail Service Availability
BPS non-resilient gateways Availability
Conference Service Booking Availability
OFFICIAL Mobile Data Interface Capability Availability
text.KPI 3 description:
Incident Management

Measures:
Incident Notification – incidents raised by Customer Authority to the Contractor and accepted or rejected within 15 minutes
Incident Acceptance – incidents raised by the Customer Authority to the Contractor (% of incidents accepted)
Major Incident Notification – % of Incidents raised by the Contractor to the Customer Authority within 5 minutes of identification 
Total incidents resolved across all Customer Authority Sites within SLA target
text.Comments: A number of measures sit beneath each KPI. The overall target for each KPI is aggregated from targets against each measure.

text.Contract: HESTIA East Region Multi Activity Contract
text.KPI 1 description:
Soft FM Availability
Intent - To monitor instances that contracted services have not been delivered (i.e. Service Defects)
Definition - Service Defect: An occurrence of non-delivery e.g. A contractor fails to provide breakfast in the Junior Ranks Mess
text.KPI 2 description:
Soft FM Satisfaction
Intent - To monitor instances that contracted services have been delivered to a sub-standard quality (i.e. Service Satisfaction Failures)
Definition - Service Satisfaction Failure: An occurrence of poor/insufficient quality e.g. A contractor fails to provide appropriate waste receptacles for the volume and type of waste generated
text.KPI 3 description: See comments
text.Comments:
The 2 KPIs selected for this report (Availability and Satisfaction) are included in the Defence Infrastructure Organisation Corporate return. The KPIs roll up a from the individual services lines which form part of Soft FM - i.e. Catering, Cleaning, Waste, Mess & Hotel Services, Misc.

Supplier KPI reporting has been suspended for this reporting period of April to June 2020. This was agreed between MOD and the supplier as part of the relief provided under PPN0220.

text.Contract: Framework Agreement for the provision of Service Management and Integration Services
text.KPI 1 description:
% of Problem investigations complete within 91 Days (All suppliers)) Equals R/P x 100% where 
P = Number of Problem records resolved or diagnosed in the Service Period. 
R = Number of Problem records resolved or diagnosed within 91 days in the Service Period
text.KPI 2 description: Service Desk call handling % of Service Desk calls answered within 30 seconds Equals B/C x 100% where B = Number of Calls answered within 30 seconds in the Service Period C = Number of Calls answered in the Service Period
text.KPI 3 description:
Incident Sev 1 supplier management (Aggregate of Managed Suppliers view): 
% of Sev 1 Incident tasks assigned to Managed Suppliers with SLAs that were resolved in the relevant Managed Supplier target time (If Managed Supplier targets or clock roles are misaligned, can only be reported if using ITSM System or using Managed Supplier reports) Equals A/B x 100%. Where : A = Number of Sev 1 Incident tasks assigned to Managed Suppliers with SLAs (that are not shorter than the overall target) that were resolved in the target time in the Service Period;  B = Number of Sev 1 Incident tasks assigned to Managed Suppliers with SLAs (that are not shorter than the overall target) and are resolved in the Service Period

The term “available” in this KPI means that the platform is functioning so that users are able to upload the relevant data (this does however exclude any temporary issues with the Internet itself and/or connectivity, any periods of Agreed Downtime and any other issues that are beyond the control of the Supplier).

text.Contract: Personal Independence Payment (PIP) Lot 1: North West, North East and England (Assessments of entitlement to personal independence payment benefits)
text.KPI 1 description: Unacceptable grade PIP assessment following audit
text.KPI 2 description: The claimant satisfaction rate
text.KPI 3 description: Assessments completed within an average actual clearance time
text.Comments:
IAS have had challenges in recruiting additional FTE in what has been a challenging market due to the uncertainty of Brexit on the wider health and social care sector.  In addition, the then anticipated devolution of PIP in Scotland from April 2020 served as a recruitment detractor. 
This period has been significantly impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic across the UK, with the suspension of all face to face assessments taking place. There was a period where no assessments took place at all and a replacement for face to face was designed and delivered in the form of telephone assessments. The effect of COVID-19 on IAS capacity to carry out assessments has been the single biggest challenge within this quarter.

Management of UK Coin Account

The management of the payment made into the UK Coinage Account in respect of the full face value of coins ordered.

With this the KPI is not being applied at this time.

text.KPI 1 description: Service Availability - This is a percentage measure of the national availability of the Airwave Network across England, Scotland and Wales in the reporting period.
text.KPI 2 description: Max Call Set UP - A measure of the maximum time to set-up a call on the Airwave network, from when a request is made to transmit on an Airwave Radio to successful connection to the intended recipient. A 100% measure means the maximum time allowed to set-up a call was never exceeded.
text.KPI 3 description: Mean Call Set Up Time - A measure of the mean time to set-up a call on the Airwave network, from when a request is made to transmit on an Airwave Radio to successful connection to the intended recipient. A 100% measure means the mean parameter measurements were always met or exceeded.
